results.title: Dad's Girl/Common Ground
results.creator_credit: Martin Daley, Judy Menczel, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Dad’s Girl” we meet Janea who lives with her mother and still misses her father years after the divorce. She discusses the effect of her parents’ divorce on her life. In “Common Ground”, Sean’s experience of his parents’ divorce and his new step-father are shown along with the changes he makes to adapt to his new family situation.

results.title: D.W. Griffith: father of film
results.creator_credit: Channel Four, Thames Television, Kevin Brownlow and David Gill
results.brief_description: A three part survey of the life and work of D.W. Griffith. His formative years in the theatre and at Biograph were followed by his major successes between 1915-1921: “The Birth of a nation”, “Broken blossoms”, “Way down east” and “Orphans of the storm”. The subsequently influential “Intolerance” was a critical and commercial failure prefiguring the failure, in the twenties, of “America”, “Isn’t life wonderful” and “The Sorrows of Satan” and later, of his neglected sound films, “Abraham Lincoln” and “The Struggle”. Brownlow and Gill make extensive use of colour-tinted extracts from his films and interviews with Lillian Gish, Blanche Sweet, Karl Brown and others. Narrated by Lindsay Anderson.

results.title: D.P.: Displaced Person
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, HTV and Alan Bridges
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Kurt Vonnegut Jnr, author of Breakfast of Champions and Slaughterhouse Five. It’s the aftermath of the world’s greatest war. Allied occupied Germany, ravaged and shamed in defeat, must now pick up the pieces. One of those pieces is a small black orphan boy named Tobias. Abandoned at a cold and dismal orphanage, he dreams - despite jeers from the other embittered children - of his courageous father’s return from war to claim him. When Tobias meets his first black man, he’s convinced the G.I. sergeant is the father of his dreams.

results.title: D.O.A = DOA
results.creator_credit: Leo Popkin, Cardinal Film and Rudolph Mate
results.brief_description: This fast paced exciting crime story was originally released as a B-movie filler but has, through the years, acquired a reputation as one of the most effective and most impressive of Hollywood film noir. Edmond O’Brien plays an insurance man, unsure about his life and his feelings for his girlfriend Paula (Pamela Britten), who on a weekend trip to San Francisco finds himself the victim of a bizarre poisoning. His attempts to unravel the mystery while counting down the clock to his death lead him to a reappreciation of his own life. Directed by Rudolph Mate who was the cinematographer for Carl Dreyer’s “The Passion of Joan of Arc” and “Vampyr”, the highly evocative cinematography, chilling musical score by Dimitri Tiomkin, and the desperate central performance by O’Brien all contribute to making this a truly suspenseful and dark piece of filmmaking.

results.title: D-evolution
results.creator_credit: Joe Weatherstone, Nicholas Searle, Steven McGregor and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
When the Huntress Shar catches her prey, the gorgeous Khan, in a lush forest glade, she thinks she’s come to the end of her hunt. But it’s only the beginning…
Combining traditional and contemporary visual effects tools, D-evolution attempts to tell a story about technology and reality, using technology itself to shape the visuals of the film.
Cast: Kate Beahan, Aaron Pedersen, Alana De Roma, Anni Finsterer

results.title: D'artagnan's daughter = La Fille de d'Artagnan
results.creator_credit: CiBy 2000, Little Bear, TF-1 Film Productions and Bertrand Tavernier
results.brief_description: In this historical swashbuckling comedy/adventure set in France in 1654, a feisty young woman (Sophie Marceau), daughter of the famed swordsman D’Artagnan, cuts short her religious studies when she uncovers a plot to assassinate the young Louis XIV. Heading to Paris she persuades her father, now in retirement, and the three other original musketeers to fight alongside her to defend their country from the insurgent forces that threaten to throw the nation into disarray. A lush, lively film assuredly directed by Tavernier that pairs old-fashioned adventure with a contemporary knowing wit and a feminist sensibility. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Philippe Noiret, Claude Rich and Nils Tavernier.

results.title: Czechoslovakia: land and people
results.brief_description: Czechoslovakia is a country of two parts: Slovakia, a rugged mountainous land, and the Czech lands, a rich farming region with many industrial cities. With historical perspective we see the two regions as part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire, then as a democracy after World War I, and finally as a Communist state.

results.title: Czechia: the Czech Republic today - tourist regions
results.creator_credit: Terra-Klub, Va Unisa and Czech Tourist Authority
results.brief_description: This is a snapshot presentation of the Czech Republic as it is today to encourage tourism to this rather unique and historical part of Europe. It briefly covers Prague, Central, Western and Eastern Bohemia, Sumava (Bohemian forest), Krknose Giant Mountains, Vysocina (Bohemian-Moravian Highlands), Southern and Central Moravia, Northern Moravia and Silesia with a basic overview of each area’s tourist attractions and historical background. Beautifully photographed, the video includes images of Prague Castle where kings, emperors, and presidents have resided, historical buildings alongside modern buildings, many examples of Baroque architecture, fairy-tale castles and chateaux, rivers, dams and man-made lakes, forests and mountains and a range of activities including swimming, boating, cycling, hiking, skiing, snow-boarding, and cross-country skiing. Steeped in history, the Czech Republic manages to blend the romantic old with the exciting new - a most intriguing region to visit.

results.title: CZ Chromozone
results.brief_description:
The year is 2035. Advances in Bio Technology including human cloning and genetic engineering are leading humanity into a realm of unprecedented physical and mental proliferation. The quest for technological innovation has become an integral part of our evolution as a species.
Chromozone is an interactive work which aims to explore the technologies of cutting edge genetic engineering and internet advancements, as they may appear in the year 2035. It is a virtual world where we as humans can modify the genealogy of our future generations.
It is a satirical work designed to raise awareness and provoke debate about the social and ethical implications of the genetic engineering of our species.

results.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
results.creator_credit: UGC Images, Hachette Premiere, Camera One, D D Productions, Rene Cleitman, Michel Seydoux and Jean-Paul Rappeneau
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Edmond Rostand, this lavish version of the classic French romance comedy combines the breathtaking wit and poetry of the play with the colour and spectacle of a good costume drama. Gerard Depardieu is perfect as the charismatic Cyrano, whose enormous nose makes him feel unworthy to love his cousin Roxanne (Anne Brochet). When Roxanne confesses her love for handsome young cadet Christian de Neuvillette (Vincent Perez), Cyrano becomes a reluctant conduit for his love when he becomes the ‘voice’ for the inarticulate Christian. Soon Roxanne has fallen in love with Christian’s handsome looks, but also with the passionate poetry of his soul, which she doesn’t realise is Cyrano. In French with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of 1991 Academy Award for Best Costume Design and 1991 Golden Globe for Best Foreign Film)
